pr_title: [CMake] Updated CMake script to change layout of build files.
pr_body:
Fixes on #1131. 

Changes:
- Updated `CMakeLists.txt`. Inside the build folder, it makes `bin` and `lib` (~~ETL~~, ~~include~~). Execution still require [these commands](https://github.com/synfig/synfig/issues/1131#issuecomment-586873899).
- Updated `.gitignore`.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 391179677, 'comment_body': 'I suggest to set `CMAKE_LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY ` to `${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/lib/`
and inside `synfig-core/src/modules/CMakeLists.txt` set to `${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/lib/modules/`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 18, 30, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391180114, 'comment_body': 'This code can be removed, if you change logic a little bit.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 18, 31, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391180291, 'comment_body': 'This code can be removed too :)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 18, 31, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391181030, 'comment_body': 'If you use CLion, please add cmake-build-* too.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 18, 33, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391194267, 'comment_body': 'Please change path to `${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/output/lib/`

Almost forgot about it.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 18, 56, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391194881, 'comment_body': 'output/bin', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 18, 57, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391195035, 'comment_body': 'here too', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 18, 58, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391201045, 'comment_body': 'here need to be relative path', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 19, 9, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391201314, 'comment_body': 'here too, change it back to lib', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 19, 10, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391205100, 'comment_body': 'But `2-build-debug.sh` builds it inside a `build` folder. 
```
  - _debug
    - build
      - lib
        - libsynfig.so  
```

Making structure like:
```
  - cmake-build-debug
    - output
      - lib
        - libsynfig.so
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 19, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391205220, 'comment_body': 'Same as above.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 19, 18, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391207443, 'comment_body': 'Ah, okay, nevermind. It works the way you told too.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 11, 19, 22, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391444549, 'comment_body': 'As we planning to use that path further i suggest to extract that path `${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/output/` into a separate variable `SYNFIG_BUILD_ROOT `', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 12, 7, 40, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391445438, 'comment_body': 'Just checked. This path must be `lib/synfig/modules` not `lib/modules`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 12, 7, 42, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391476375, 'comment_body': 'That makes sense. Would make things easier to maintain in the future. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 12, 8, 54, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}]

[{'comment_id': 391575983, 'comment_body': 'Please add COPYONLY, as it is faster and does not require parsing the file.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 12, 12, 6, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Updated imagepath in case SYNFIG_ROOT is undefined.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 391804862, 'comment_body': 'This will not work in the situation when you copy binary to another place. 
I suggest to use `App::get_base_path()` to get base path :)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 12, 18, 13, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391805944, 'comment_body': 'That part is already refactored.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 12, 18, 15, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 391814496, 'comment_body': 'I see :) But just try to copy `output` folder to another place, and you will see what it stops working.
So i suggest to fix it another way.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 12, 18, 31, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392576802, 'comment_body': 'As far as we know what we do not broke Windows logic, you can just remove the whole Windows ifdef block (as it already undefines IMAGE_DIR):
```
#ifdef _WIN32
#	ifdef IMAGE_DIR
#		undef IMAGE_DIR
#		define IMAGE_DIR "share/pixmaps"
#	endif
#endif
```

and change this to:
```
imagepath=App::get_base_path()+"/share/pixmaps";
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 14, 11, 5, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392576923, 'comment_body': 'Same with #ifdefs here', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 14, 11, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392576979, 'comment_body': 'Make it one line: `uipath=App::get_base_path() + "/share/synfig/ui";`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 14, 11, 8, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392586617, 'comment_body': "This is unnecessary as you always rewrite it later. So it's safe to delete this line of code.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 14, 12, 57, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392586721, 'comment_body': 'Here you loose logic for windows build (using autotools), so you need to change it to something like:

```
#if defined CMAKE_BUILD || defined WIN32_
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 14, 12, 59, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392586810, 'comment_body': 'Here the same.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 14, 13, 0, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392586824, 'comment_body': 'make it one line', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 14, 13, 1, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392586881, 'comment_body': 'This can be removed too.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 14, 13, 1, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392606742, 'comment_body': 'It can't be since operation on `synfig_root (char *)` and `"what/ever/path (char[n])` is invalid. Same for the one which is not merged into one line in `get_image_path()`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 14, 17, 56, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392643601, 'comment_body': 'Ok. You can use:
```
ui_path = std::string(synfig_root) + "/share/synfig/ui";
```
This will be the same.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 15, 5, 44, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392644250, 'comment_body': 'Also please note what under Windows image path is "/share/pixmaps/", under Linux "/share/pixmaps/synfigstudio".
As this requires also to fix autotools script, i suggest to add one more `#ifdef` here and fix it later.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 15, 6, 0, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392644392, 'comment_body': 'No need to use `+=`. Anther programmer my think you have value in uipath, but it must be empty. So just use:
`uipath = std::string(synfig_root)+"/share/synfig/ui";`
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 15, 6, 2, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 393442898, 'comment_body': 'Oh, missed that one hahaha.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 17, 4, 47, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 393447295, 'comment_body': "If the image path on Windows is `/share/pixmaps/`, then should I also make changes according to that path [here](https://github.com/synfig/synfig/pull/1247/files#r393446705) because I've moved everything to `PIXMAPS_DIR=${ROOT}/share/pixmaps/synfigstudio/` without taking into consideration the system it's built on. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 17, 5, 7, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 393453283, 'comment_body': 'Good question! Since we don’t need the same behavior for autotools / cmake, I suggest using the correct path "/share/pixmaps/ synfigstudio" for CMake build and "/share/pixmaps" for autotools build.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 17, 5, 34, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
Fixes: #1132 

I've made these changes on top of changes proposed in #1232 (I'll rebase these changes onto master once it's merged).

This will reduce the cmake building commands to:
```
mkdir build-cmake && cd build-cmake
cmake ../
make -j4
make build_images -j4
./output/bin/synfigstudio 
```

Existing issues:
- Rebuilding of images everytime (#1229).
- ~~Running binaries after running `make install` doesn't seem to run, it throws~~

Once these are fixed, we can even update [documentations](https://github.com/synfig/synfig/blob/master/README-CMake.md).
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 392838932, 'comment_body': 'make_directory is deprecated. Use file(MAKE_DIRECTORY) instead.
https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/file.html', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 16, 7, 59, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392839322, 'comment_body': 'This is exactly what I had mean. Awesome!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 16, 8, 0, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392839746, 'comment_body': 'synfig_bin has `-o <output_file>` option. You can use it, and remove that line.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 16, 8, 1, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 392839981, 'comment_body': 'Do not forget to change install path also.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 16, 8, 2, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 393446705, 'comment_body': 'over here', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 17, 5, 4, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 393696386, 'comment_body': ':)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 17, 13, 55, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 393701628, 'comment_body': 'Different CMakeLists.txt files have different minimum version. 
```
./ETL/CMakeLists.txt:cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 2.8)
./CMakeLists.txt:cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 2.8)
./synfig-studio/src/CMakeLists.txt:cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.1)
./synfig-studio/CMakeLists.txt:cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.1)
./synfig-core/src/CMakeLists.txt:cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.1)
./synfig-core/CMakeLists.txt:cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.1)
```
We should update the version for those 2 above and probably should also make it consistent with other, either by being on `3.1` or `3.0`. It is kinda off topic-y but still.

 And I will update it so that it uses `file(MAKE_DIRECTORY)` instead of `make_directory`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 17, 14, 3, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 393719081, 'comment_body': "Didn't make any changes on minimum version yet, but fixed the other part.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 17, 14, 26, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Fix for no icon in Import Image Layer for CMake Build.

pr_body:

Samples:

pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 434435025, 'comment_body': 'Please add a new line at the end of the file.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 3, 9, 31, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 434436962, 'comment_body': 'You do not need to fill the language list manually. Each `po` folder has a `LINGUAS` file. Read the list of languages using the [file](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/file.html) function.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 3, 9, 34, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 435068913, 'comment_body': 'Why not to use `file(STRINGS ...` here?
So you don't need that part:
```
string(REPLACE "\n" ";" LANGUAGES "${LANGUAGES}")
list(APPEND LANGUAGES ${LANGUAGES})
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 4, 8, 7, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 435069736, 'comment_body': 'Better to rename `LANGUAGE_LIST ` to `PO_FILES`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 4, 8, 9, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 435070405, 'comment_body': "`gettext_process_po_files` can add INSTALL target by self, so you don't need to do that.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 4, 8, 10, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 435193768, 'comment_body': "I was thinking about using that INSTALL, however, it will not install the files as the bash script does, which is like this.
this is how bash script does that...
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34449856/83753453-f2a64480-a687-11ea-8472-4becdae3e866.png)
It won't rename those files to `synfig.mo` and `synfigstudio.mo` but instead, it will use the base names, like `ar.mo`, something like this.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34449856/83753144-61cf6900-a687-11ea-9d86-e886cf49997f.png)
In fact, to properly use this, we also need to pass the `lang` parameter, but then, using that method, it will result in a type of code which I sent before, like the one that had 108 pofiles targets.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 4, 11, 49, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 436027293, 'comment_body': 'I think we can put all of this strings inside `if(GETTEXT_FOUND)` condition.
After that you can move all this code to the function.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 5, 16, 20, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 436236756, 'comment_body': 'I think making a `/cmake` folder and moving this code to a function in a file over there could be a good option too. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 6, 4, 30, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 436251314, 'comment_body': 'I support that.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 6, 8, 40, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437357569, 'comment_body': 'I suggest adding a little description of why we do not use the CMake `FindGettext` module for this.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 12, 8, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437357901, 'comment_body': 'Also please check what happens if mgsfmt is not found.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 12, 9, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437375160, 'comment_body': 'I put the description in `/cmake/gettext.cmake`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 12, 32, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443769007, 'comment_body': 'Here is my addtion to comment:

Although CMake provides functions for processing .po files, it cannot be used because GETTEXT_PROCESS_PO_FILES installs files with an invalid name. For example: for an en.gmo file, we should get the ${LOCALE_DIR}/${language}/LC_MESSAGES/${project_name}.mo, not ${LOCALE_DIR}/${language}/LC_MESSAGES/en.mo, as it does, so we need to get the possibility to pass ${project_name} to that function and use it for file naming.
We also added an issue to CMake:
https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/issues/20792', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 19, 9, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443772733, 'comment_body': 'Which function requires version 3.1?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 19, 17, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443982779, 'comment_body': 'We are using version 3.1 as a minimum in `synfig-studio/CMakeLists.txt` and `synfig-core/CMakeLists.txt`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 23, 6, 8, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 444638951, 'comment_body': 'Yeah, they need to be fixed too. Added issue here: https://github.com/synfig/synfig/issues/1509', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 24, 4, 34, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}]
pr_commits: [{'commit_sha': '99cde0a7c6ddabd58e907af8b5bc382b5743daa5', 'committer_username': 'AYESDIE', 'committer_name': None, 'committer_email': None, 'commit_date': datetime.datetime(2017, 12, 11, 14, 26, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'commit_sha': 'dc3397bab1b962521f3371bcf06a196648b59c70', 'committer_username': 'AYESDIE', 'committer_name': None, 'committer_email': None, 'commit_date': datetime.datetime(2017, 12, 11, 14, 26, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

pr_body: Fixes the issue in CMake build where app resource path is incorrect.

pr_title: Changes for appveyor build using CMake and ninja.
pr_body:
Changes related to moving appveyor builds to CMake and ninja. 

Also #1488
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 445582940, 'comment_body': 'Since the real path can be for example `d:\msys`, it is better to use `/opt/mlt-6.16.0/lib/pkgconfig`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 25, 14, 3, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 445583126, 'comment_body': '```
echo "${PKG_CONFIG_PATH}"
ls -la /opt/mlt-6.16.0/lib/pkgconfig/
```

This part can be removed.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 25, 14, 3, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 445622251, 'comment_body': '(these were some test changes I was trying, to build something on my system and over here simultaneously)

But then, you asked me to remove the prefix part from CMake. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 25, 14, 56, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 445629876, 'comment_body': "Will remove it before it's ready to be merged. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 25, 15, 6, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 453282191, 'comment_body': 'I think is better to check MSGFMT_FOUND', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 12, 7, 48, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 453282905, 'comment_body': 'This issue is related to `intltool_merge` and it throws an error because despite of it being found by CMake, it is an unrecognized command.

```[357/724] Generating ../../../output/share/synfig/plugins/add-skeleton-simple/plugin.xml
FAILED: output/share/synfig/plugins/add-skeleton-simple/plugin.xml
cmd.exe /C "cd /D D:\msys64\home\user\synfig\cmake-build-msys\synfig-studio\plugins\add-skeleton-simple && D:\msys64\mingw64\bin\intltool-merge -x -u -c D:/msys64/home/user/synfig/cmake-build-msys/synfig-studio/po/.intltool-merge-cache D:/msys64/home/user/synfig/synfig-studio/po D:/msys64/home/user/synfig/synfig-studio/plugins/add-skeleton-simple/plugin.xml.in D:/msys64/home/user/synfig/cmake-build-msys/output/share/synfig/plugins/add-skeleton-simple/plugin.xml"
'D:\msys64\mingw64\bin\intltool-merge' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 12, 7, 56, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 453307862, 'comment_body': "Yes, I meant that you need to check `if(INTLTOOL_MERGE)` (just don't have a code to look the name), because this is not Windows/Linux related error.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 12, 12, 3, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 454570745, 'comment_body': 'I will take a look at this.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 14, 18, 49, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456946136, 'comment_body': 'Build must also be compiled on 32-bit systems.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 19, 19, 32, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456946157, 'comment_body': 'This will not work on 32-bit systems.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 19, 19, 32, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456946307, 'comment_body': '```
MLT_PATH="/opt/mlt-${VERSION_MLT}"
```
Since MLT is installed using an absolute path, there is no need to make it relative', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 19, 19, 33, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456946708, 'comment_body': "If I understand correctly, this does not work because `INTLTOOL MERGE EXECUTABLE` is not available.
So it's better to check if `INTLTOOL MERGE EXECUTABLE` is available.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 19, 19, 37, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456946738, 'comment_body': 'Same here', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 19, 19, 38, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456946746, 'comment_body': 'And here', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 19, 19, 38, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456946766, 'comment_body': 'Here too', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 19, 19, 38, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 457057414, 'comment_body': 'There are `libmng` issues with 32-bit systems.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 20, 5, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 457061158, 'comment_body': 'As shown in the Appveyor build, it is available [here](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/Synfig/synfig/builds/34171306?fullLog=true#L617). In MSYS, when we use that with `add_custom_command`, it uses `cmd` to run it and since `intltool-merge` is not an executable file, it doesn't recognize it as an internal command. It's how I mentioned it before [here](https://github.com/synfig/synfig/pull/1491#discussion_r453282905).
```
FAILED: output/share/synfig/plugins/add-skeleton-simple/plugin.xml
cmd.exe /C "cd /D D:\msys64\home\user\synfig\cmake-build-msys\synfig-studio\plugins\add-skeleton-simple && D:\msys64\mingw64\bin\intltool-merge -x -u -c D:/msys64/home/user/synfig/cmake-build-msys/synfig-studio/po/.intltool-merge-cache D:/msys64/home/user/synfig/synfig-studio/po D:/msys64/home/user/synfig/synfig-studio/plugins/add-skeleton-simple/plugin.xml.in D:/msys64/home/user/synfig/cmake-build-msys/output/share/synfig/plugins/add-skeleton-simple/plugin.xml"
'D:\msys64\mingw64\bin\intltool-merge' is not recognized as an internal or external command,```
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 20, 5, 21, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 457237915, 'comment_body': 'You can compile without requiring libmng as autotools does.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 20, 9, 55, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 457239709, 'comment_body': '> it uses cmd to run it and since intltool-merge is not an executable file

Yes, that is why you are checking if the binary is available or not. Maybe you can do a minimal reproducible example?
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 20, 9, 57, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 457841928, 'comment_body': "Going for an absolute path in CMake doesn't seem like a good option considering MSYS2 can be installed anywhere on the system and that we need path like `D:/msys64/opt` or whatever. That's why I kept it relative. 

Also, I'm unsure if we can find path on `msys` from CMake so that's why I kept it relative to `MINGW_PATH`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 21, 5, 17, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 457863580, 'comment_body': 'I made a small repository ([457239709](https://github.com/AYESDIE/457239709)) to reproduce that same issue.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 21, 6, 23, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459258378, 'comment_body': 'You can use `/opt/...` path, and translate it to windows path using `cygpath` tool', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 23, 7, 21, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459264151, 'comment_body': 'Ok, thank you! Now I see the problem.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 23, 7, 34, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459298169, 'comment_body': 'This is example, how it can be fixed:
```
find_program(INTLTOOL_MERGE intltool-merge)

# When MinGW is used without MSYS environment (for example, Ninja
# generator uses the standard Windows `cmd` shell for building), `intltool-merge`
# cannot be started, because it is just a Perl script, and `cmd` does not know how
# to run it. In this case, we need to explicitly add the interpreter to the command.
if(INTLTOOL_MERGE AND MINGW AND NOT MSYS)
  message(STATUS "Fixing intltool-merge command...")
  set(INTLTOOL_MERGE perl ${INTLTOOL_MERGE})
endif()
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 23, 8, 41, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459509411, 'comment_body': 'Also this problem should be fixed by this commit (https://github.com/synfig/synfig/commit/f8f918f6610ed01f66dc1d89b79a17b53123f8cb)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 23, 14, 51, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459520045, 'comment_body': 'This part is fixed, it builds on 32 bit system as you can see [here](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/Synfig/synfig/builds/34234842).', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 23, 15, 5, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460794920, 'comment_body': 'Is this still needed? It looks like the libmng issue has been resolved.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 27, 10, 26, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460809499, 'comment_body': 'If I understand correctly this part will not work with Ninja generator, because `MINGW_PREFIX` looks like `/mingwxx`, but Ninja requires the full Windows path like `c:/msys64/mingwxx`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 27, 10, 56, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460809980, 'comment_body': 'Maybe better to set correct environment variables for Appveyor, like Tor did?
https://gitlab.torproject.org/ahf/tor-clone/blob/caa55a6d37426073dc264d2adec7201ec65aec19/.appveyor.yml', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 27, 10, 57, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460811370, 'comment_body': '`INTLTOOL_VERSION_STRING` is version info is required?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 27, 11, 0, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461404928, 'comment_body': 'Not that it is necessary but it helps to find modules. You can read about it [here](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.3/module/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.html). An implementation of something similar can be seen [here](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/blob/master/Modules/FindGettext.cmake#L81). The idea here is make sure whether *intltool-merge* can be run on a system or not.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 8, 22, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461404986, 'comment_body': 'It does return the full Windows path tho.

A quick change in `InstallMSYS2.cmake`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34449856/88638708-7f460f80-d0d9-11ea-94e2-8c6360334fb5.png)
And that shows
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34449856/88638748-8bca6800-d0d9-11ea-9e53-c17e0df17f3f.png)
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 8, 22, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461536573, 'comment_body': 'Nice catch!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 12, 21, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462090458, 'comment_body': 'Looks like this issue still persists for 32 bit systems. 

https://ci.appveyor.com/project/Synfig/synfig/builds/34360394/job/buwkh6yd60byonlg#L1763', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 7, 20, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462816708, 'comment_body': 'Yeah, you are right. Just checked locally, and the problem is that `libmng` is incorrectly built on 32-bit MSYS. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 30, 7, 55, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462818980, 'comment_body': 'I addressed the other changes then. You can review this. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 30, 7, 59, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Copy plugins, brushes and sounds to the appropriate place in CMake build.
pr_body: Up until now, even though the build didn't require them, files in `plugins`, `brushes` and `sounds` folders weren't being copied to CMake build folder. This should fix that issue.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 442149235, 'comment_body': 'This code looks like a good candidate to make a function from it and use it everywhere to copy/install files.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 18, 11, 11, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 442734938, 'comment_body': 'Also in this case why not just use a file(COPY...) to copy the entire directory?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 19, 9, 33, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443707091, 'comment_body': 'Maybe group lottie plugin files to something like:
```
set(PLUGIN_LOTTIE_EXPORTER
    effects/allmask.py
    ...
    helpers/bezier.py
```
and so on?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 17, 10, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443710284, 'comment_body': "Won't the way it's done be more consistent? Even other projects follow something similar where each directory has it's own *CMakeLists.txt* file.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 17, 16, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443758968, 'comment_body': 'The main idea is to make the code cleaner and more understandable. But when I look at this code, I can’t understand what it is trying to do. Is there any logic inside subfolders? Does it change some files? Also this code will be difficult to maintain.

One of the reasons to creating makefiles in each directory is just a comfortable way to run the `make` command without going to the parent directory. But here we are not compiling anything, just copying the directory to some place.

And about other projects. Here is a piece of Inkscape code, for example::
https://gitlab.com/inkscape/inkscape/-/blob/master/src/trace/CMakeLists.txt', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 18, 49, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 445629727, 'comment_body': 'Better to make a function for intltool and use it everywhere. 
Also better to add a warning instead of error if intltool not found, so code can be compiled, just without translations.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 25, 15, 6, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}]
pr_commits: [{'commit_sha': '836b46a978c0c0abbc7457fc0a7f320a7f045f40', 'committer_username': 'AYESDIE', 'committer_name': None, 'committer_email': None, 'commit_date': datetime.datetime(2017, 12, 11, 14, 26, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'commit_sha': 'd007f97f889425abc9f66461f6d8ab0114b9b732', 'committer_username': 'AYESDIE', 'committer_name': None, 'committer_email': None, 'commit_date': datetime.datetime(2017, 12, 11, 14, 26, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

pr_body:
There are still changes that are to be made to this.

But in the meantime, to test things out, the following commands can be used.
```
mkdir build && cd build
cmake ../
make 
make build_images
make build_pofiles
make plugins_xml
make package
```
Once this is done, there will be a .deb file and a .tar.gz file in the build folder.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34449856/86362550-1367b700-bc93-11ea-955e-1e28536e4fe2.png)

Once .deb package is installed from either terminal or from UI, you can run Synfig Studio by running this on the command line.
```
synfigstudio
```


To-do:
- [x] Set up version properly.
- [x] Set up dependencies and the dependency version properly.
- [x] Set up an icon.
- [x] Set up a better description rather than *README.md*.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34449856/86362978-c0daca80-bc93-11ea-847f-937ab766ea73.png)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 449823335, 'comment_body': 'Stumbled on this [StackOverflow answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/34800667/13138783)
https://github.com/synfig/synfig/pull/1525#issuecomment-653833203

Better and intelligent CMake code to copy:
```cmake
configure_file(logo.sif logo.sif COPYONLY)
```

**input** is automatically mapped to `CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR`
and **output** to `CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR`
so no need to explicitly enter the path variables :)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 5, 2, 31, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Keyikedalube', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 449830825, 'comment_body': '`configure_file` is used to work with `*.in` files to substitute variable values referenced in the file content. Yes, copying is an alternate use of `configure_file`, however, `file(COPY ...)` preserves timestamps of input file as well. 

[CMake configure_file](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/configure_file.html)
> Copies a file \<input\> to file \<output\> and substitutes variable values referenced in the file content.

[CMake file](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/file.html#copy)
> Copying preserves input file timestamps, and optimizes out a file if it exists at the destination with the same timestamp.

You can check one use of `configure_file` [here](https://github.com/synfig/synfig/blob/master/synfig-studio/images/CMakeLists.txt#L276).', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 5, 3, 49, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 449843040, 'comment_body': 'https://github.com/synfig/synfig/pull/1525#issuecomment-653851114', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 5, 7, 6, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Keyikedalube', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 450866403, 'comment_body': 'Better to do this part, like Inkscape did:
https://gitlab.com/inkscape/inkscape/-/blob/master/org.inkscape.Inkscape.desktop.template', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 7, 13, 32, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 450870578, 'comment_body': 'Perhaps it is better to rename it to something with `STUDIO` in the name, so that it indicates that this function can only be used for a studio project?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 7, 13, 37, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 451394270, 'comment_body': "They used `configure_file` in a way we used it to configure `splash_screen_development.sif.in` where it replaces the `${INKSCAPE_ICONPATH}` with the value of that variable. Making changes to this would also require changes in autotools script, and I'm not too used with scripting in that.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 8, 9, 3, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'AYESDIE', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 451608197, 'comment_body': 'Agree.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 8, 14, 54, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Fixed Magick NoEncodeDelegateForThisImageFormat issues on appveyor build.
Removed README-CMake.md and linked CMake documentation in README.md.
[CMake] Added basic support for MSVS 2019 and vcpkg
pr_body:
Steps:
- Run `.\1-install-vcpkg.bat` in the vcpkg directory using PowerShell.
- Open the project in VS 2019.
- Use `Visual Studio 16 2019 Win64` as generator. 
- Set `-DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=...` parameter.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 475376410, 'comment_body': "I suggest to use `%VCPKG_DEFAULT_TRIPLET%` environment variable, so we can easily switch between triplets.
```
set VCPKG_DEFAULT_TRIPLET=x64-windows
c:/projects/vcpkg/vcpkg.exe install boost-odeint fftw3 gettext glibmm gtkmm libxmlpp libsigcpp pango sdl2-mixer zlib
```

Also we don't need the full BOOST installation, only Boost.odeint.
", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 24, 6, 49, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 477309776, 'comment_body': 'fontconfig', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 26, 13, 42, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ice0', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body: Added documentation for building and packaging in CMake on Linux, OSX and Windows machine.
Apparently, the code in the main repository was updated and the CPack Generator was not automatically assigned based on the opearting system, so this fixes that out of date documentation.
